Hi,
I'm also working on a large distributed application,
which is written mostly in Java.

We use Corba for remote communication, which makes testing a little
bit easier because you can run a Corba server within the same process
without
changing the code. This works quite well, but it requires that you write
very
clean Corba code. You also  might not find some common errors. In Corba it
is for example
not allowed to sent null as an out parameter, and running the Corba Server
within the same
process does not catch the error.

Therefore I currently also run the same tests using a real Corba server.
This can be done without implementing the tests again.

What really would be needed, would be an infrastructure where I could
install, start and stop
a Corbaserver on a remote machine automatically. This would probably require
that an additional daemon process would run on the remote machine.

I believe this wouldn't be difficult, and would probably not require any
changes to Junit.

Regards,
Markus
